review_title: Huge potential, incredible self-driven learning opportunity. Challenging Times (UK)
pros: One of the best, technology led organisations I've worked for, in my 40 year career. Huge resources and immense opportunity to learn about new and evolving technologies. Help is available if you choose to embrace the nuances of the cultural environment. The range of incentives and rewards for those who show progress and results are the best in the industry (in my opinion).
cons: Huawei is challenging and a very different environment and those who fight against those differences will struggle. For those who are able to operate independently and possess the right mindset, with some luck, they can do well. These are tough times for the UK Enterprise business unit however, for reasons which are not of Huawei's own doing.

review_title: A good company for mid-career technical people who look for a break-out role
pros: - A growth company w/ a lot of room for seasoned technical people.  Huawei America research lab is rapidly growing and gaining more and more influence inside the company. Huawei is going through a stage of becoming leaders in its technical fields but has some catch-up to do. The higher-ups have realized the importance of technical expertise (especially from US) and put a lot of efforts in attracting and supporting...
cons: - Huawei fundamentally still operates/manages like a Chinese company where centralized decisions were made and sometimes abrupt changes of policies. That could be hard for people who are used to the American company culture.  I would say if you are not flexible enough you may not survive the first year of Huawei.  - Working experiences may vary a great deal across groups  There is no uniform high standard of...

pros: You get to work in a fast-paced culturally varied workplace, depending on how well you develop in the company, your contacts and interview process, salaries can vary greatly from competitive to poor but it is generally competitive. cons: Given that it is based in China, knowledge is vastly protected. It is particularly hard to get access to technical documentation that is required to service, especially if you are still outsourced. There is no Career Plan at all, position titles are more of a tag and lack meaning; because of this it is not unusual for "raises" to be based on personal connections rather than skill and they are largely unaccompanied...

In short it is lacking the organizational culture of western companies.

pros: Global company and has a lot of growth opportunity to learn and to advance. The company has good benefits and pay is good. Very result oriented company so a good performance employee can be recognized and advance quickly.

pros: Learn about chinese management, cultures and a lot of travel opportunities.

review_title: Good for fresh student, hard life to stay long.
pros: Good reward if you do hard and well. Have chances to do core/new technologies which are good for fresh student.
cons: Very busy, no enough manpower allocated, and project schedule is extremely tight. Tough company environment and the managers are usually very aggressive and not kind to the employees.

review_title: Huge company, lots of opportunities to grow and a very complex Hierarchy
pros: If you are a recent grad looking to gain some hands on experience and get to actually do it without a lot of micromanagement, Huawei is the right place to go. You learn a lot, the pressure is constant and the deadlines to close projects are even more strict, however that allows you to grow exponencially in a short amount of time as a professional.
cons: There is a very complex hierarchy system, it's difficult to keep track of who is the boss and who is not. The multicultural environment is a big challenge and depending on some peoples temper, it is not uncommon to see big discussions happening around the office. There is a lot of work to be done in this department (Team playing).

review_title: One strong and very dynamic experience
pros: 1.- Learning how to deal, respond and deliver under high pressure circumstances. 2.- Multicultural context and cross functional teams 3.- Growth opportunities
cons: 1.- Low salaries and packages  2.- High employees turnover

review_title: Strange company to work for in the US
pros: Broad scope and lot of energy. No one cares whether you accomplish anything or do nothing. Opportunity to travel.
cons: Centrally controlled by headquarters. You are not really able to get anything done as you would be in an American company.

pros: LET network builber and mantainence provider. good team working.

review_title: Fast moving company with global ambitions, but poor management once you leave China
pros: Many new experiences for a senior executive from Western MNC from a Chinese MNC perspective in Shenzhen. Much eagerness to hear about different approaches to solving their problems. High pace to work through many global issues simultaneously. Able to connect the various problems in a global approach. Senior leadership wants to improve the company for customers, suppliers and employees.
cons: No willingness to improve the transparency of corporate governance in a substantial way. No employee sharing holding for non-Chinese employees, though an experiment is occurring in India at present. No willingness to put non-Chinese in many senior positions and none on its Board of Directors. Managers move to frequently, so difficult to build leadership and team skills. Very poor ability to develop non-Chinese...

review_title: Horrible working atmosphere and environment. Think at least five times before joining this company in India.

cons: This is the horrible place to work for any experienced people. If you are laterals and experienced professional then never ever join this company even in dreams. This company is torture chamber for the talented and skilled people. If you have 7-10 years of experience and join this company then you will treated like freshers here. The local management with fancy designation who stayed here for a long term have very...

pros: Work wise its very good , you be technically strong

review_title: A great Chinese owned international company
pros: Huawei has a great leader, Mr. Ren, although he is not young now. Career opportunity is great if you have really good ideas and know the way how management system works and how Chinese works. Almost everybody is working hard. Lots of opportunities to develop your abilities of multiple domains. Huawei is a company owned by employees -- you contribute more, you get more in the long run.
cons: It's hard to get balance between work and life. To really get along with the company culture is pretty hard for a western employee.

pros: - Best place to learn and implement new technologies. - Good pay - get to work with real smart people
cons: - Employees overloaded with work at the cost of short time to deliver

review_title: It is a good company for a first job but not recommended in the long run.
pros: - quite fair appraisal system ; - good compensation & benefits package (yearly salary increase, monthy / yearly awards, overtime payment, transportation allowance); - friendly working envirnoment and helpful staff (of course, this also depends on the team and people you are working with).
cons: - constant change of work responsabilities and tasks / no clear direction or strategy, not even for medium term ; - a rules / process based working process / very little opportunities to change anything ; - communication with chineese staff is often full of difficulties and misunderstandings (even top management chineese staff does not handle english language or any other language except chineese, very well); -...

review_title: Working with Huawei Technologies opened me up to a world of endless technologies and created a strong work attitude

cons: If you don't love technology or don't enjoy what you do, don't go here.

pros: you can attend to most of training and learn even in Job.

review_title: Good or bad? It's really depends on which department you are in

Not much over time working. Not any more, Huawei had changed. You learn all the skills which a big company could give.
cons: Poor management. Half of the team leaders and project managers I have met were under qualified, they might be good at writing code but they don't know how to effectively manage people. Limited career path. Already too many leaders and managers, not much room for going up. Flat management structure. Same as above, like KFC or McDonald's, you are just a worker. Very difficult to transfer. It's almost impossible to...

cons: Working in a shift ruins all your life schedule as your shifts switch between days and nights every week.

review_title: Company with High Potential but low on values
pros: One of the very few companies where you are given freedom to the fullest extent. Even has a fresher your opinion is counted and discussed.  Helpful colleagues . You will be working in a supportive environment where you project related issues are quickly solved.   No junk work like filling excel sheets , preparing documents etc. If developers expect to code all day and testers expect to break the system......
cons: Very Very strict deadlines . Almost everyone have the experience once in a while to stay up the entire night to meet the deadline.  Week end workings ( compensated ) . Although this has been declining..  Poor HR facilities. Get used for paying for coffee / tea .. , less team outings with low team outing budgets.

pros: It may depends on the place you are working in. But I had a lot of opportunities to learn new stuff and apply new knowligies in real projects

pros: Salary increase according to the performance. Awarding system for all departments, I got 2 awards and 5 years. My work was well balanced between office hours and customer site hours. My managers were really helpful and excellent leaders trying to get the best out of me. They sent me to china twice, first time with customers for an international event and the second time for training. Even during the training they...
cons: The work life balance may not be appropriate for many people. At the beginning I was a workaholic there, but after getting serious with family planning I started paying more attention to the balance which is always fine as long as you meet the targets.   Also it may get stressful sometimes and often you will find yourself multitasking. It's also a fast paced environment sometimes.

review_title: Pros and Cons of Huawei Technologies India Pvt Ltd, Bangalore R&D center
pros: Learning opportunity, Exposure are good for people who have thirst to work hard and zeal to learn more, Never laid off any one till now. minimum Yearly hike and bonus are guaranteed.
cons: Work pressure to complete tasks with in deadlines, no work from home option so balancing work and personnel life is quite challenging

pros: Its an eye opener. If you would like to learn how a large Chinese corporation works then you will learn a lot. I certainly learnt a lot. I travelled the world doing business for Huawei in Europe, Asia, Africa and the way Huawei does business is very different from Western companies. All in all a good learning experience for me.
cons: Unless you are Chinese born national and willing to commit a 6-10 years to the company there is a glass ceiling for most non-chinese employees. The company is very hierarchical and has a very much a top down command and control structure. If you want to collaborate with your peers on a new idea or initiative you cant just discuss and get going with your peers - you have to go up through your chain of command and...

pros: Great place for those starter to joint and learn. Huawei have very strong business model, focus customer and reward staff.
cons: long working hours and weekend work.

review_title: MNC that provides preferential treatment to mainland Chinese,sidelining local hires
pros: Good exposure to a very localised China's business culture without having work in China itself. One will learn how to work with mainland Chinese and receive extensive practice of mandarin (spoken) and written Chinese.  Despite the general lack of work-life balance, the unique chinese culture is such that if you are successful at getting into key management's good books, you can literally get by with doing minimal...
cons: Other than a serious lack of work life balance, where employees are expected to work overtime, weekends and even public holidays, there is a huge disregard for local staff ie. Non mainland Chinese hires.  Local employees receive lower if not no variable bonus (if they are under another hiring scheme).  Promotion and relocation opportunities are also meant for mainland Chinese, usually regardless of performance....

pros: Latest technology Networking with carriers Promising company future (reliable company) Since there will be no job definition, you end up learning a lot from different areas trying to achieve your tasks or goals
cons: No job definition, start to end Working expectations Cultural shock No long term opportunities for locals Everything is self-learned

pros: Basically, you got quite a bit of free time for leisure. Go learn golf, pick up something you like, interact with customers and be close to them. You can practically grow old and retire here if you do not mind the miserable salary and horrid long hours.
cons: Salary - Forget about fat bonuses if you are not from China (Not even Asians!!). The salary scale tipped the point of below mediocre and expect yourself to be like this for years to come. If you are holding a CHINA passport, yes there are perks beyond imagination like private shares, but if you are not, stop dreaming and look the other way.  Management - What's that again? That doesn't even exist!! You would likely...

pros: There is a good opportunity to learn and build your career

cons: Organization, the company is not as organized as it could be, Training, lots of internal training for new tools, which causes the employee reduction of available time, PBC does not reflect your real job, once you are not evaluated for the ones who know your job.

pros: Good company and learn knowledge there.
cons: Senior engineers give lots of help and learn new knowledge.

review_title: A strange environment where east meets west and do not mix (Huawei Device USA)

cons: Everyone comes to an employer with a mix of expectations. With Huawei, the challenge is there is much work to be done, but little in way of top level management to focus and prioritize. This results in a very strong feeling of apathy amongst many.

pros: good package,excellent campus and a good work culture

Or I would say, it wants to everything. Really, everything. It doesn't have a CTO office to make the plan for...

employee_title: Director Operations Managed Services Middle East Region
review_title: Customer first is the slogan so customer satisfaction is guaranteed.
pros: Huawei is the only major telecom network provider among the top five in the world (Ericsson, NSN, Alcatel-Lucent and ZTE being the other four) which is owned by its employees. So employee retention and career development is a priority.
cons: One of the reason Huawei won majority of its contracts is competitive pricing. However, such prices put lot of pressure on delivery teams to maintain quality of delivery in the given project cost. This results in customer dissatisfaction and loss in delivery. This is especially evident in managed services contracts.

So to summarize the pros and cons   1....
cons: 1. Unbalanced work life. Inefficient project planning, unattainable deadlines, which in turn squeeze   the employees to log long hours continuously for months even. My personal best was 33 hours at a stretch, just taking 1 hour break for my basic needs. Many of my colleagues were logging 18 hours continuously in a day and this continued for many months even. 2.
